sentences.english: Maybe it is the period that she referred.
sentences.chinese: 也許這既是她指的那個時期。

sentences.english: Fish in the Mekong, they are both food and also economics, " Trandem said."
sentences.chinese: 湄公河裏的魚既是食物，也涉及經濟範疇。

sentences.english: This is both a blessing and a curse.
sentences.chinese: 這既是一種幸運也是一個禍根。

sentences.english: It's both a clincher and it overcomes reluctance' to buy.
sentences.chinese: 這既是個決定性因素，也解決了人們買車的後顧之憂。

sentences.english: It gives the narrative in a form which is both much abridged and plainly secondary.
sentences.chinese: 它使敘事的形式，這既是許多刪節和顯然是次要的。

sentences.english: The stage is both a golden period of accelerating development and a period with rising social contradictions.
sentences.chinese: 這既是加快發展的黃金期，又是社會矛盾的凸顯期。

sentences.english: Kwanzaa is a time for learning as well as joy.
sentences.chinese: 寬扎節既是喜慶的時刻，又是學習的機會。

sentences.english: This is our management culture, but also to Jia Jia's purpose.
sentences.chinese: 這既是我們的管理文化，也是嘉能佳的宗旨。

definition: to act as/used erroneously for 作為|作为
one's conduct/deed/activity/accomplishment/achievement/to act as/as (in the capacity of)/qua/to view as/to look upon (sth as)/to take sth to be
variant of 是[shi4]/(used in given names)
equivalent to either 是[shi4] or 就是[jiu4 shi4]
the road one must follow or take/the only way
(emphasizes that sth is precisely or exactly as stated)/precisely/exactly/even/if/just like/in the same way as
